snippet: In a motion, lawyers for the Department of Justice’s antitrust division said they were prohibited from working on the trial over the merger between American Airlines and US Airways, even on a voluntary basis, without appropriation from Congress.
abstract: In a motion, lawyers for the Department of Justice’s antitrust division said they were prohibited from working on the trial over the merger between American Airlines and US Airways, even on a voluntary basis, without appropriation from Congress.

headline.main: Justice Department Forced to Delay Airline Antitrust Trial
